item.title: Implementing module import policies in CPython
item.description: Introduction Supply chain attacks are the new big thing! Several points in the package distribution chain from maintainers to version control repositories to package repositories can be targeted to distribute malicious software. INSERT!examples eg: ssh key stealing, etc To wreak havoc, we need access to operating system APIs. In my opinion, the primary ones are: Filesystem. To read or write to files is crucial to either persist malware or to read sensitive files (eg.
